data.shownotes: This show featured the debut of Blame It On the Weather. I’m Not In Your Mind contained Rattlesnake teases and Boogieman Sam quotes. Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs. Mystery Jack was introduced as the oldest song that would be played that night, followed by a tease of “Frankenstein” (Edgar Winter Group). Mystery Jack was played for the first time since 2018-11-24 (86 show gap). Ataraxia was on the written setlist but was replaced by Doom City. Following O.N.E. opening band Body Type was shouted out. The Dripping Tap featured a “flute jam” duet between Stu and Cecil Coleman of Body Type and contained Pill teases and Cellophane teases/quotes.

I’m Not In Your Mind and Sea of Trees contained The Dripping Tap teases. Gaia featured a drum solo. Work This Time, which featured a guitar solo, was dedicated to Joey’s partner Edith (Amby’s sister), who briefly appeared on stage.  The Dripping Tap was introduced by Amby as a song he wrote about his kitchen sink and contained Cellophane teases.   Straws in the Wind was dedicated to Cavs' nipples.  Joey shouted out Mildlife following Straws.  Rattlesnake contained O.N.E. teases/quotes, Automation teases and See Me quotes.

This was a fully acoustic show, the first one performed by the band outside of Australia. The River contained Wah Wah teases. Muddy Water featured Ambrose on sax. Cookie and Ambrose played on the same piano during Mr. Beat. Blame It On The Weather was introduced by Ambrose as a song about the weather in Melbourne, as well as being introduced as a song about Ambrose's dog by Stu. In the intro to The Bitter Boogie, which also featured Ambrose on sax, Joey says that the show is a "beta test" and asks if any of the crowd are going to Coachella, which the band played two days later. Dirt and Hot Water featured Mildlife guitarist Adam Halliwell on flute. Most Of What I Like also featured Ambrose on sax. The solo in Let Me Mend The Past was ommitted. Her and I featured Mildlife drummer Jim Rindfleish on congas and contained a Sleepwalker quote and tease and Crumbling Castle teases. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings exist. All songs listed were confirmed through audio/video recordings, however The River through Muddy Water and Most Of What I Like are only partially available so any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Nuclear Fusion was dedicated to Skrillex. Stu did the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion at Joey’s request. SPELLLING and Amyl and the Sniffers were shouted out after Plastic Boogie. Her and I contained Iron Lung quotes and Slow Jam 1 quotes. Evil Death Roll contained Alter Me teases and quotes. Boogieman Sam was dedicated to Belgium (home of sound tech Gaspard Demulemeester) and contained Cut Throat Boogie quotes. Amby introduced The Dripping Tap as a song about his water bill.
data.venuename: Event Lawn at Virgin Hotels Las Vegas

data.shownotes: This show featured the debut of Predator X.  Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs.  Rattlesnake contained teases of Billabong Valley, O.N.E. and Automation.

Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases.  Gamma Knife contained People-Vultures teases. Self-Immolate featured a drum solo by Cavs.  Her and I contained an Am I In Heaven? tease, Iron Lung quotes/teases, Slow Jam 1 quotes, Ice V teases and The River teases.

Rattlesnake contained O.N.E. teases. Following Sea of Trees an audience member gave Stu a slap bracelet which he put on and then returned. Slow Jam 1 contained an Iron Lung jam with lyrics. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

3 hour marathon set. Before the show, "Timeland" was played on the speakers. The intro to Nuclear Fusion was done by the band's sound tech Gaspard. Mr. Beat contained a Persistence tease. Billabong Valley contained a Sleep Drifter tease. During the setbreak, "Smoke & Mirrors" was also played via the venue's speakers. I'm Not In Your Mind contained a Dripping Tap tease. Gaia featured a drum solo. Cellophane featured Stu on flute. The River was dedicated to "Ambrose's ass" and the second segment was played faster per Stu's request. Work This Time featured a guitar solo. Before The Dripping Tap, Stu shouted out the band's crew. The Dripping Tap contained Iron Lung quotes. Mystery Jack was on the setlist after The River, but not played due to time constraints. 

Poster By Jake Foreman

Before Blame It On the Weather, Stu said they would play Vegemite next, but then clarified he was joking. After Blame It On The Weather, Stu tells a story of Joey sleepwalking and relieving himself on his new modular keyboard. Leading Joey to joke his new DJ name was Urine Man. The Garden Goblin was dedicated to Urine Man. During it, there was technical difficulty during which Stu discussed his accent. After The Garden Goblin, Joey says the song is about Cook’s dog, which Cook interjects, “yeah I miss him!” Work This Time featured a guitar solo. The Book featured a drum solo. Open Water was introduced as "one of our many songs about water" and also featured a drum solo. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam.

Poster By Daniel Herwitt @sunflower_form
data.soundcheck: O.N.E.; Predator X; Sadie Sorceress; The Garden Goblin; The Book; Cranes, Planes, Migraines

data.shownotes: Honey started with a Sleep Drifter intro and contained Sleep Drifter, Nuclear Fusion, and Billabong Valley teases. The River contained Iron Lung teases. Before Gamma Knife, Ambrose quoted "That's not a knife… THAT's a knife." from Crocodile Dundee and the song was introduced as a song about the future of knives. The Bitter Boogie featured Ambrose on sax. The Lord Of Lightning was on the printed setlist before The Bitter Boogie but was not played.

This was the second of five nights in Barcelona for Primavera Sound. Stu’s Gibson Holy Explorer and Joey’s Gibson Flying V were crushed by a lift before the show. Mr. Beat contained Iron Lung teases. Wah Wah contained The River quotes. Only Part I and II of The River were performed. The Lord of Lightning was on the printed setlist but was not played. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. The Mind Fuzz Suite, People-Vultures, Blame It On The Weather, Hell, Plastic Boogie, and The Book have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Converge (Demo) (or as it was known at the time, Uncolonize) played through the PA as the band walked on stage. Planet B was dedicated to the nearby wildfires. Honey contained Sleep Drifter teases. The Garden Goblin was introduced by Stu as a song Cookie wrote about Lucas, before Cookie clarifies that its about his dog in his garden. There were PA issues during Pleura and the show was paused midway through The Garden Goblin when the PA went down. During the pause the band reminisced about Radiohead's sound cutting out at Coachella 2017, a festival King Gizzard also performed at. Grace Cummings was thanked before Blame It On The Weather. Robot Stop contained Ice V quotes and Hot Water teases. Boogieman Sam contained Cut Throat Boogie quotes and teases. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Gaia through Robot Stop have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete or incorrect. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

This show featured the live debut of Magma. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo. The Garden Goblin was introduced by Cookie as a song that he wrote about his dog. Leah Senior was shouted out after Magma. Rattlesnake contained Doom City, O.N.E., Honey, Nuclear Fusion, Billabong Valley, & Automation teases and quotes and Sleep Drifter teases.

Poster Art by Jason Galea
130 Standard / 30 Foil Print
Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over a metal vamp from the band. Ambrose quoted “Evergreen” (Leah Senior) before The Dripping Tap. Poster By Jason Galea 230 Standard / 30 Foil

This show featured the live debut of Hypertension. The Reticent Raconteur and The Lord of Lightning were performed with Leah Senior providing the narration. I’m in Your Mind contained Cellophane teases. Cellophane contained Alter Me teases and quotes. Self-Immolate featured a Cavs drum solo which led into a brief metal vamp and ultimately returned to Self-Immolate. Rattlesnake contained Automation and Nuclear Fusion teases. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam.

Hot Wax was announced as a dedication to Joe Santarpia, one of the band's sound engineers. Hot Wax was played for the first time since 2022-04-28 (50 show gap). I’m Not in Your Mind contained Alter Me teases and quotes. Cellophane contained Am I in Heaven? teases and Hot Wax quotes. Ambergris was introduced as a song about “the most expensive ingredient in modern humanity.” Iron Lung featured an extended Red Hot Chili Peppers style intro while Lucas was using the restroom, followed by additional mid-song banter about Lucas. A New World through Altered Beast II featured Leah Senior providing the narration.

Vomit Coffin featured the now-infamous “Amby Snot Rocket”. Blame It on the Weather was humorously announced as the “complete opposite style of music” to the show-opening Murder of the Universe suite. Work This Time featured a guitar solo. Cut Throat Boogie was announced as a song about Ambrose getting stabbed in the neck with a broken bottle. Wah Wah began with the intro to The River and subsequently featured The River quotes and teases, as well as a jam. Sadie Sorceress featured an additional verse from The Grim Reaper played over the music to Sadie Sorceress. Joey requested the cameraperson zoom in to his face as close as possible during the intro to Self-Immolate and introduced Cavs as “John Henry Bonham”, followed by a drum solo and a “Moby Dick” (Led Zeppelin) tease, plus an additional brief drum solo and “Moby Dick” tease at the end of the song. Before Her and I (Slow Jam 2), the weather was discussed and the band’s ignorance regarding Fahrenheit to Celsius conversions was revealed. The song itself featured a Flamethrower jam, Slow Jam 1 and Magma teases, and a brief Cut Throat Boogie jam. Hot Wax was dedicated to one of the band's sound engineers, Joe Santarpia. Timeland was played over the PA as the setbreak music. Head On/Pill opened with “The Star-Spangled Banner” intro, contained Hypertension teases and a Witchcraft tease, and was unfinished leading into Am I in Heaven?. Venusian 1 closed with a Cavs drum solo which led into Venusian 2. Ambrose introduced Billabong Valley as being about a bushranger and is interrupted by Joey calling him “mad-cunt Morgan”. Let Me Mend The Past, which contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote, was announced as a song about Ambrose’s somewhat troubled upbringing and was dedicated to Edith, Ambrose’s sister. Alter Me III and Altered Beast IV were performed with Leah Senior providing the narration. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. Tetrachromacy and Hypertension were on the printed setlist but cut due to time constraints. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as part of Live at Red Rocks ‘22. Poster By Jason Galea Second Edition of Poster

Gaia contained Motor Spirit teases. Her & I (Slow Jam 2) contained Iron Lung quotes and teases. This Thing was played for the first time since Feb. 21, 2020 (94 show gap) and contained The Dripping Tap quotes. Before Magenta Mountain, Stu announced that he was a “dickhead." Joey subsequently changed the lyrics of Magenta Mountain to “I don’t believe Stu”. Robot Stop contained Hot Water and Her & I (Slow Jam 2) teases. During Hot Water Stu took over drums & Cavs crowd surfed. Shanghai, Trapdoor and Evil Death Roll were on the printed setlist but were not played. Poster By Drew Millward
